_header: At wrestling my leman I chose
Subjects: games; erotic verse; sermons, verse in; women, as speakers/narrators
_description: A popular rhyme in a sermon — one couplet, or four lines rhyming aaba or aabb

CULIi38.Transcription:
Ate ston casting my lemman ichesand atte wrastling sone i hym
                    lesallas þat he so sone felwy nadde he stonde better vile
                    geres
CULIi38.Note:
Four lines in a sermon on Ezechiel 6:11 (ff. 86-89v); lines
                    3-4 repeated further down page, with ending, ‘stonde vile
                    gorel’.

CamTCC43.Transcription:
Atte wrastlinge mi lemman ichesand atte ston kasting i him for
                    les
CamTCC43.Note: Two lines, quoted in a sermon against such songs.
